description: From Middle French devester (“strip of possessions”), from Old French desvestir, from des- (“dis-”) + vestir (“to clothe”).

verbs.description: devest (third-person singular simple present devests, present participle devesting, simple past and past participle devested)

entries.meaning: (law, transitive) To take away, as an authority, title, etc., to deprive; to alienate, as an estate.
(law, intransitive) To be taken away, lost, or alienated, as a title or an estate.
